intro: Rubus foliosus var. microstemon, commonly known as the small-stamen raspberry. This variant of the raspberry plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and its compact growth habit. It typically produces small, tart berries that are often used in local culinary traditions. The plant thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
